meanings.definition: A standard or criterion by which something is judged or recognized.
meanings.sent1: In our school, good behavior is a touchstone for receiving rewards.
meanings.sent2: Honesty is often considered a touchstone of a trustworthy person.
meanings.sent3: The touchstone of a successful party is everyone having a great time.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the touchstone that brightened up his day.
meanings.sent5: Kindness can be a touchstone that leaves a lasting impact on others.

meanings.definition: A test or criterion for determining the quality or genuineness of a thing.
meanings.sent1: The taste of the food served will be the touchstone of the restaurant's reputation.
meanings.sent2: The touchstone of a good friendship is being there for each other in tough times.
meanings.sent3: The touchstone of a good joke is making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her work became the touchstone of her success.
meanings.sent5: The touchstone of a reliable product is its durability and performance.

meanings.definition: A hard black stone, such as jasper or basalt, formerly used to test the quality of gold or silver by the streak left on it when rubbed.
meanings.sent1: The jeweler used a touchstone to determine the purity of the gold.
meanings.sent2: Miners would carry a touchstone to check the quality of the precious metals they found.
meanings.sent3: The touchstone accidentally left a mark on the table when it was placed there.
meanings.sent4: The touchstone revealed the true value of the silver through its distinctive mark.
meanings.sent5: The touchstone's black surface showed the authenticity of the gold through its streak.
